intro: Chaerophyllum temulum f. atropurpureum, commonly known as purple-stemmed cow parsley, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a short stem with a distinctive purple hue, which gives it its common name. This plant is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and can thrive in partial to full shade.
